job_title: RBC Technology & Operations - Corporate Systems Program (Co-op) (79735)
job_description: At RBC we know that to excel, we must first create; opportunities for growth, environments that foster collaboration, and rewards that recognize achievement.  We have the resources employees need to reach their full potential, enabling them to deliver outstanding service to our clients and create careers they can take pride in. Technology and Operations (T&O) plays a critical role in the day to day activities that align with RBC’s business strategies, outcomes and objectives to ensure continued focus on enabling leading advice and service for RBC clients that is backed by technological and operational excellence. Corporate Systems has global responsibility for technology services to the following diverse functions; Risk, Finance, Compliance, Corporate Treasury, Human Resources, Fraud Detection and Procurement. Corporate Systems Co-op Program In the search for its future leaders, Corporate Systems is offering a co-op program for undergraduates with career-defining opportunities to build upon their dynamic critical thinking and interpersonal skills.  This program offers the opportunity to learn about the financial sector and how technology is being used to deliver innovative solutions that differentiate RBC from its global competitors. The Corporate Systems Co-op Program provides the opportunity placement in a variety of streams, supporting technology services to one or more functional areas in the business.  The Corporate Systems Co-op Programoffers positions within the following five unique streams: Technical – Technical Systems Analyst, DeveloperBusiness  - Business Systems AnalystProject-Based – Project ManagementQuality Assurance – Quality Assurance AnalystSupport – Support Analyst Apply your talents and expertise for the opportunity to: Gain in-depth knowledge of the key functions that support a large banking organizationCollaborate with teams around the globeIdentify key opportunities for improvement and provide creative technology solutions to business issues
job_requirements: Qualifications All interested candidates must be able to demonstrate the following to be considered for interview: Practical experience with an object oriented programming language (Java, C#, C++)ORApplied experience in project managementAn interest in, or experience with financial markets and the use of technology to solve business problems Additionally, successful candidates should possess the following: Leadership acumen and a passion to apply it in a dynamic business environmentExcellent interpersonal and highly developed communication skills (verbal and written)Confidence in working autonomously or as member of a teamCapability to manage multiple priorities across a number of assignments and prioritize effectivelyAbility to resolve any minor conflicts/issues and escalate to others as appropriate Upon completion of the Corporate Systems co-op placement, you may have the opportunity to build your career at RBC through the Corporate Systems Rotational Program once you graduate. If you want to be a part of our exciting team and gain career-defining exposure to the RBC Technology & Operations business, please apply to this opportunity. Open To All Majors:No
